heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 12 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 5 days and counting started on 09 September 2025 and ranks 11th in length since records started in 23 September 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (200°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%) and rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 8653 lux) and cloud levels (up 712 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 10666 lux), cloud levels (up 1174 m), feels like temperature (up 5.7°C), and outside temperature (up 4.3°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 711.9m lower than yesterday, 719.8m lower than the past week, 1174.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 939m minimum and 3180m maximum, with an average of 1074.4m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1794.2m and 2250m.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, occasional overcast conditions, and bright intervals likely. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
